wikipedia_page.main: Benjamin Thomas Williams (19 November 1832 – 21 March 1890) was a Welsh barrister and Liberal Party politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1878 to 1882.

response: *Benjamin Thomas Williams — Desirableness of a University for Wales
*19 November – Benjamin Thomas Williams, lawyer and politician (d. 1890)

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1880 United Kingdom general election

response: * Benjamin Thomas Williams (1832–1890), British Member of Parliament for Carmarthen, 1878–1882

The by-election was caused by the appointment of the sitting Liberal MP, Benjamin Thomas Williams as a county court judge. Williams had himself been elected as MP for Carmarthen at a by-election in 1878.
The Liberals selected Benjamin Thomas Williams, QC, a successful barrister and a former Recorder of Carmarthen.
